definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: The true night suddenly smiled to make a noise.
December 1, 2006 — Food scientists have discovered why Rice Krispies make their characteristic sound when soaked in milk.
sentences.chinese: 食品學家發現了食物在牛奶中浸泡發出聲響的原因。

sentences.english: What’s the dish in the middle making all the noise?
sentences.chinese: 桌子中間發出聲響的是道什麼菜？

sentences.english: - When a Treant falls in the forest, does it make a sound?
sentences.chinese: 一個樹人在森林裏倒下時，會發出聲音嗎？

sentences.english: She does not laugh out loud; she only chuckles.
sentences.chinese: 她沒有笑出聲來，只是抿嘴而笑。

sentences.english: Everyone was quiet when Janice suddenly burst out crying.
sentences.chinese: 大家都沒出聲，珍妮絲忽然哇地一聲哭了起來。

sentences.english: No sensible person will read aloud in the library.
sentences.chinese: 識大體的人是不會在圖書館裏出聲讀書的。

sentences.english: The tadpole produce the sound by pushing air out of their lungs.
sentences.chinese: 這種蝌蚪通過將空氣從肺中擠出，來發出聲音。

sentences.english: He attached a bamboo flute to a paper kite.
sentences.chinese: 他把能發出聲音的竹笛綁在了紙鳶上。

sentences.english: To avoid the yips he changed his style of putting.
sentences.chinese: 爲了避免發出聲音，他改變了打球方式。

sentences.english: Leonard: You shush, I'm happy. I want to talk about it.
sentences.chinese: 你別出聲我樂死了我想談談。

sentences.english: Neither of us made a sound and the Cat didn't want to get off the bed until the sun came up.
sentences.chinese: 我和貓咪都不出聲，直到天亮了它才肯下牀。

sentences.english: Perhaps the enchanted site is the throat, where voice is born.
sentences.chinese: 或許受感召的位置是喉嚨，從這裏發出聲音。

sentences.english: Romeo wanted to speak out, but waited for her to say more.
sentences.chinese: 羅密歐很想出聲說話，但他等待茱麗葉把話說完。

sentences.english: You know how when you slap or flap meat, it makes a noise?
sentences.chinese: 你知道當你拍打肉的時候，它會發出聲音嗎？

definition: first tone in Mandarin (high, level tone)
to open one's mouth/to start to talk
in a low voice/(speak) in whispers
to overdo it/to overstep the limit/excessively/above one's head/overhead
to rain curses (on sb)/to let sb have it/to bawl sb out
